stream_context.summary: Kaze prototypes the interior of a cowboy-themed Milk Bar Saloon, refactors Dry Bones behaviour, experiments with Biobak’s additive-window technique, and discusses music cartridge plans, future course themes, and story tone.
level: Cowboy Desert – Milk Bar Saloon (part of Course 7)

development_findings.summary: Laid out the Milk Bar Saloon: bar on the right, two floors with tables, a small stage, swinging saloon doors, support beams and a hidden chalky-milk back room accessed by an invisible door handle.
development_findings.quote: Somewhere along the walls there’s just going to be a doorknob … Mario is just going to open a door in the wall and then you enter the room with the bad guys.

development_findings.summary: Dry Bones in this course now require a ground-pound to defeat; Kaze already changed the code and wrote placeholder NPC dialogue to teach the mechanic.
development_findings.quote: Now you can no longer kill them … without a ground pound. One guy will tell you, 'Them Dry Bones up in them hills, they’re tough as all leather – your little hops ain’t gonna make a dent.'

development_findings.summary: Uses Biobak’s ‘additive combiner’ window trick to fake translucent panes; approximately 14 000 polygons split over three rooms, kept within original N64 limits.
development_findings.quote: Unfortunately I can’t use Biobak’s combiner here … but additive combining will look sick and still be one-cycle.

development_findings.summary: Keeps RAM footprint at or below 8 MB; refuses to rely on Expansion Pak or leaked Nintendo code to stay ‘in-spirit’ with original hardware.
development_findings.quote: I’m not interested in ever using more than 8 MB … going beyond the original limitations is against the spirit of the challenge.

development_findings.summary: Investigating new libdragon tech that streams compressed audio; proposes selling a standalone N64 cartridge with the entire RTYI soundtrack, custom box and booklet (~US$100).
development_findings.quote: If the whole decompressing MP3 on N64 works out … I’m probably gonna make a separate cartridge and release this with a box.

development_findings.summary: After watching Lost Impact speedruns he feels some late-game themes are ‘uninspired’; leaning toward a small moving space-station course with gravity tricks and scrapping a casino/comic/musical idea.
development_findings.quote: Course 13, 14, 15 … maybe they’re a little uninspired. I was thinking a space shuttle where you help friendly NPCs fight space pirates.

development_findings.summary: Plans to overhaul Course 2 indoor raft section into a more dynamic platforming area using fling-vines, to raise ‘slide & platforming’ density.
development_findings.quote: Instead it’s gonna be mostly a platforming section … we already have fling vines, we just need to introduce them properly.

development_findings.summary: Story will be lightened; existing ‘slavery plot’ deemed too dark for Mario context and likely removed.
development_findings.quote: We have to overhaul the story … the whole slavery plot is a little bit dark for a Mario game.

development_findings.summary: Uses ChatGPT routinely for code snippets and to cowboy-ify dialogue, seeing AI as a productivity boost.
development_findings.quote: AI is a very good tool – why wouldn’t you take advantage of a great tool?

development_findings.summary: Debated C vs C++; maintains that object-oriented style is language-agnostic and prefers plain C for ROM-hacking.
development_findings.quote: Being object-oriented is not a property of the language … I can do object-oriented programming in C. Who’s gonna stop me?

context_findings.summary: Kaze frames hacking morality pragmatically: if you mod Nintendo’s IP without permission you can’t complain when people mod your mod.
context_findings.quote: If you hack someone else’s game without their consent you should also be fine with someone hacking your hack against your consent.

context_findings.summary: States he ‘will never stop creating’ and sees creation as the ‘purpose of the human soul’.
context_findings.quote: What would be the point of an existence where you don’t create? … Are you even alive anymore at that point?

context_findings.summary: Expresses disdain for rigid colour theory and conventional music theory, preferring intuitive or mathematical experimentation.
context_findings.quote: Who decided the colour wheel was the truth? It makes no sense – someone just invented that.

context_findings.summary: Mentions personal health: cutting weight, heavy squats causing sore legs during stream.
context_findings.quote: My legs hurt so bad … I increased the weight for my squats and that’s a bad combination.

context_findings.summary: Plans to compensate contributors (e.g., Badub) if soundtrack cartridge happens; notes desire for more funding to pay artists.
context_findings.quote: I would like to pay a lot of artists that help with this game. I’m definitely gonna pay Badub for the OST.

biobak.summary: Provided the window additive-combiner technique and textures that Kaze integrates into the saloon.
biobak.quote: Dude, Biobak, we need to use your window technique here – the universe aligned to make this happen.

badub.summary: Composer of RTYI; Kaze intends to pay him for OST if physical cartridge proceeds.
badub.quote: I’m definitely gonna pay Badub for the OST if we do end up making that cartridge.

zeina.summary: Supplied updated window textures and is handling Dry Bones animations; active in chat and second on stream’s chat-recap list.
zeina.quote: Are you also doing the Dry Bones animations? … OK Zeina, sounds good.

key_stories.title: Designing the Chalky-Milk Saloon
key_stories.summary: Kaze conceives a cowboy milk bar where patrons secretly drink ‘chalky milk’. He drafts layout, hidden door, enemy cast and lore live on stream.
key_stories.challenge: Create a memorable indoor set-piece that fits cowboy desert theme.
key_stories.process: Sketched room zones, planned NPC conversations, coded Dry Bones buff, used ChatGPT for cowboy slang, built geometry and additive windows.
key_stories.outcome: Initial room geometry, window shaders and enemy behaviour are functional; needs art-polish and secret door implementation.
key_stories.key_quote: Somewhere along the walls there’s just a doorknob… Mario will open a door that blends in perfectly and you enter to find the bad guys.

key_stories.title: Soundtrack Cartridge Idea
key_stories.summary: New libdragon tech may let high-quality audio stream on real N64. Kaze wants to press a dedicated cartridge with RTYI’s OST, complete with box art.
key_stories.challenge: Hardware can’t normally store full OST at high fidelity.
key_stories.process: Monitor libdragon decompression work; consider Opus format; brainstorm pricing and packaging.
key_stories.outcome: Concept approved in principle; Kaze commits to pay Badub and treat it as a collectible rather than required purchase.
key_stories.key_quote: If the MP3 decompression works, we’ll release a separate cartridge with a box – it’s theoretically useless but very cool.

key_stories.title: Course Theme Pivot After Lost Impact Reflection
key_stories.summary: Watching a Lost Impact speedrun makes Kaze worry some late-game RTYI themes feel ‘uninspired’.
key_stories.challenge: Match or exceed the creative density of his previous hack.
key_stories.process: Lists scrapped ideas (music level, comic-book city, oversized casino) and embraces a moving space-station with gravity tricks.
key_stories.outcome: Space-station course tentatively chosen; other themes shelved pending ‘dream-inspired’ alternatives.
key_stories.key_quote: Course 13, 14, 15… maybe they’re a little uninspired. I was thinking a space shuttle where you help friendly NPCs fight space pirates.

key_stories.title: Reworking Course 2 Interior
key_stories.summary: Kaze decides an existing raft-coin section is ‘lame’ and should become a vine-flinging platforming gauntlet.
key_stories.challenge: Increase slide and platforming density across game.
key_stories.process: Plans to scrap rafting area, add fling-vine gimmick with proper onboarding.
key_stories.outcome: Design decision set; implementation pending future stream.
key_stories.key_quote: It’s gonna be mostly a platforming section… we already have fling vines; we just need to introduce them properly.
